text: A good book, but it has been hyped up way too much. Reading the book makes you feel good, positive and energetic, but the strategy in the book doesn't necessarily work. The quality of paper is very good, but the price is quite high too. Buying and reading a paperback would be better. Do not rely on this book alone if there is something you are trying to achieve in life. You've got to work towards whatever you want to achieve and not only think positive and dream all day long.

text: Kudos to Rhonda Byrne for so nicely packing the known secret in the book"The Secret". What the mind constantly thinks and what one focuses constantly on the thought of the mind takes shape in the form of reality. i can quote a number of instances from my own life wherein every thing happened according to what I thought it should happen. I started believing more in the 'Law of Attraction' after reading the book "The Secret". It is a must read for every individual if he wants to give a meaning to his life. Desire leads to thought, thought leads to action and action leads to result. We need to tune our mind to think positively all the time to avoid negative things happening.Never allow any fear or doubt entering your mind. We can lead a happy life, healthy life and prosperous life if only we program our mind to achieve the same and believe 100% on the 'power' within ourselves. This is the message given in the book "The Secret". After reading the book 'The Secret" one can read another book by same author titled as 'The Magic" to see the magic happening in real life.
title: The known secret is rightly packed in the book "The Secret"

text: Almost everyone has heard the phrase: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs all in the mind,‚Äù but how many have ever tried to understand its importance and implication? I was also a part of this crowd until a few days ago, till I was gifted ‚ÄòThe Secret‚Äô by my father. This book by Rhonda Byrne changed my way of life, renewed me and taught me how to live a peaceful and contented life and be an architect of my own happiness and success. In this book, the author unveils a ‚Äòsecret‚Äô which she claims to have been known for centuries. In the words of the author, ‚ÄúIt has been passed down through the years, highly coveted, hidden, lost, stolen, and bought for vast sums of money.‚ÄùThe essence of the book is the power of our minds, which if identified and unleashed properly, can create waves of positive changes in our life. It deals with tuning our thought process which has the capability of making things happen; things that we otherwise would have never have imagined occurring. Everything that happens to us is directly or indirectly the doing of our own thoughts, which if modeled properly, can change everything in our lives. The book deals with the above mentioned theory scientifically, saying that our thoughts are magnetic and a frequency is associated with each one of them and when they are sent out into the universe, they attract like objects which are reflected back to us. In short, our thoughts become things.This book answers questions like why are we asked to culture good and healthy feelings right from our childhood. As a matter of fact, these are the things that decide the course our lives take. The importance and need of feelings and emotions, the need to sometimes give in to things that our hearts desire for, the need to prematurely ‚Äòfeel‚Äô the things we want to happen, the need to take good care of our health, the need to treat ourselves with love and respect, the ways to make our relationships with others work, the need and ways of expressing our gratitude to the Maker as well as everyone and everything that have touched our lives ‚Äì all these have been discussed intricately in a detailed manner in the book.
title: renewed me and taught me how to live a peaceful and contented life and be an architect of my own happiness and success

text: Very nice book, motivating and uplifting. At the same time, it lacks substance. For example, we have extreme poverty in the world. Even a country like America has poverty. Should the secret be used to accumulate only individual wealth? Why can‚Äôt the author and all the great people listed in the book stand together and eradicate poverty in America? I live in a much more worse country. In India, where I live, the roads have potholes. Is it possible for me to use the Secret to remove potholes from all roads in India? Well, these are some of the questions I have. And the book does not answer these questions.

text: I am writing this review after more than a year of practice in law of attraction. I read this book first time in 2014. The best and the only book I have ever read completely with interest. Read it for every 3 months as a practice for few years may be a 2 or 3 years. See the magic in your thoughts and thinking after years. See it's quit obvious that secret won't work If I dream to reach mars and waiting for the secret to work. Believe me too: The secret will work for sure. Don't ask me how but It will work magically. It worked for me all the time if you are a realistic person. I dreamed and felt like I was driving Elite I20 from the day it launched, Finally I got elite I20 only after thinking lot of possibilities like Baleno, swift, Jazz, Figo etc. Even I booked Baleno and waited for 4 months but finally cancelled and took I20 only. Now don't ask me how it worked :) Lot of examples in my life like this.. Everything will work. Trust in yourself, you can do anything and everything - Swami Vivekananda.Pros:1) Your way of thinking will completely change after reading this book2) You will be in boosted mood with full positive thinking3) Really it works for most of the times. The secret worked for me most of the times.4) The fact and you feel that there is really someone connected through your thoughts and making your wishes come true.5) You will see completely new version of you after reading this book.
title: The best and the only book I have ever read completely with full enthusiasm

text: The Secret is a self-help book by the Australian author Rhonda Byrne trying to explain how your thoughts are the driving force of your life. This wasn‚Äôt a book that I couldn‚Äôt avoid for too long for I always found this book in large numbers in bookstores; not just in English but in a lot of other languages which naturally kindled my curiosity as to what was so special about this and also the fact that the same was ceaselessly suggested by some of my friends.The book starts with revealing The Secret which I believe is the law of attraction proposed in this book, that is, you attract what you think and your life is crafted by your thoughts. It the sequentially mentions how this law could be used for wealth, relationships, health, weight reduction, etc.I liked it as to how the book is trying to trigger positive thinking for that is something I lack; in the sense that I think of all the possibilities and under the doctrine of being prepared for the worst, I more often than not, think only about the worst possible outcome and I guess I would use some of what the book has said to ensure a balance. The book also endorsed one of the strongest philosophies that I believe in; something which I liked (which is not agreed upon in most supposed spiritual books); that you‚Äôre the master of your own fate / destiny. I also liked the way in which the book was presented; each discussion being split into various chapters and then, at the end of each, you had a summary of what was stated in each of these chapters. The book was also concise considering the whole message was delivered in around 200 pages meaning that you don‚Äôt have to be a voracious reader in order to complete this book.However, my problem with this book, predictably, was the excessive justification through pseudoscience; for one, comparing this law of attraction on a par with the law of gravity is outrageous to being with and two, some outrageous claims were made by the author where she stated that even though she didn‚Äôt study physics, by sheer thoughts, she perfectly understands quantum physics today; a topic which most physicists have struggled to crack with this popular quote from the physicist Richard Feynman ‚Äì ‚ÄòIf you think you understand quantum mechanics, you don't understand quantum mechanics.‚Äô Moreover, I believed that this book could be taken to induce positive thinking on the topics but then; her tips on topics such as health or financial management or dieting should be straightaway dismissed.I always like reading on topics which I don‚Äôt ideologically agree with such as metaphysics, in this case and to be honest, I had a good time reading this book and some of the author‚Äôs suggestions were good which I could possibly implement and of course, predictably, I was totally outraged by some of her comparisons and analogies which I have touched upon previously. To conclude, I would say that this is a reasonable book with some practical solutions and a lot of codswallop. On the whole, I would award the book a rating of three.
title: I liked it as to how the book is trying to ...

text: A must-read for everyone who wants to lead a life full of vibrancy, optimism, love and magic. I strongly recommend that you carry a copy of this book with you always. Every word in the book is like a precious gem. It highlights, albeit in a gentle fashion, the pitfalls of a routine and monotonous life and how we can all change that by changing the radio frequency of our thoughts. We just need to change the frequency! The Good angels are all there to protect you, to help you, to rediscover yourself.... you only need to call them and they will be there to take care of you...Remember to remember... Everyone has the power to change what destiny has in store for them... but remember to remember that you have the power. Be aware of the power that you possess. Change the lens with which you have always looked at the world and now you will see a world full of love, life and magic. The significant take away from this book is that - YOU MUST LOVE YOURSELF & NEVER STOP THANKING THE ALMIGHTY AND THE ANGELS....It is a great healer....This is the perfect book for dealing with the vicissitudes of life in today's stressful times.
title: The most brilliant book that can change your lives...

text: Have you ever wondered how the great personalities like Albert Einstein, Henry Ford, Michaelangelo have succeeded in their respective roles ? How did they overcome their trepidations, suspicions and worries ? What made them enormously believe in their power to make a good change to this world ? Have they also faced the dauntingly gruesome repulsion from their peers and if yes, how did they manage to keep their sanity alive ? All the above questions continuously bugged my mind and i am sure it does the same to you. The Secret by Rhonda Byrne talks about the very factor in complete detail. In this book, the author restated the secret behind getting exceptional in any area. The secret to life, the secret to wealth, the secret to relationship etcetera has been elaborated in different chapters.Author explained firmly  that Universe would grant you everything you wish for provided you have it clear in your mind. It goes well with the saying that vague goals leads to vague results. In order to turn your dreams into reality, there's a three step procedure that needs to be followed sincerely. It begins with 'ask' which indicates that one needs to ask whatever one aims for. The Universe would not understand unless you made it so. The second being 'believe', that means you need to have utter belief that you are going to get what you asked for. And last one being 'feel' describes that one should start feeling the way one would on getting what they aspires for. According to Rhonda, a person should start experiencing the ultimate joy before actually having it.  By gaining absolute surety, there is nothing which could stop a man from reaching to this final destination.Talking about the book wholesomely, it was a good read backed by various statements by renowned motivators and teachers like Jack Canfield. The only thing which i didn't like much is the lack of examples in the book. Though every text was powerful enough to boost one's confidence, nonetheless i somewhere felt the absence of practical approach. The whole book was filled with quotations, texts and principles. Seldom did i find any success story or example to back these rules. It would have been much better and less tedious if author had tried working on that part too.
title: A book revealing the secrets of life.

text: It is said that you should never have high hope about anything. We are human beings, not programmed machines, and hence forget this very logic many a time. Resulting in a broken hope and a dull day.That exactly was my condition after reading ‚ÄúThe Secret.‚ÄùStop reading this blog post at this point, if you intend to read the book. I am going to reveal the ‚Äúsecret‚Äù from ‚ÄúThe Secret.‚ÄùAs you have decided to continue reading, here you go. Do you want to become famous?Think, feel, of becoming famous. You feel it as if you already have become famous. Act as though everyone around and media (both national and international) is speaking about you. Feel it. Believe it. Realize it.Bingo!You have become famous. The ‚Äúlaw of attraction‚Äù will make you famous.Do you want to become a millionaire?Think, feel, of becoming rich. You feel it as if you already have billions of money in our bank account. Feel it. Believe it. Realize it.Bingo!You have become famous. The ‚Äúlaw of attraction‚Äù will make you rich.Do you want to achieve something?Think, feel, of becoming achieving that particular thing. Feel it. Believe it. Realize it.Bingo!You have achieved that unachievable thing. The ‚Äúlaw of attraction‚Äù will make achieve it.This is what is said in the 198 page long book. One thing, ‚Äúthe law of attraction‚Äù is repeated in every other sentence. As though you sit dreaming about it and everything will happen by itself.I am neither saying the theory is wrong, nor apprehensive about the power of subconscious mind. On the other hand, I am a firm believer of the power this universe possesses. Of course, it can ‚Äúmake‚Äù things happen.I am of the opinion that ‚Äúif we don‚Äôt know or believe about a thing, doesn‚Äôt mean that the particular things does not exist. But we have not yet developed the apparatus to identify or prove the existence/ non-existence of that particular thing.‚ÄùForget about the universe, we have not yet made any progress in studies with respect to our own ‚Äúunconscious mind,‚Äù and has not fully understood ‚Äúsubconscious mind,‚Äù which are presumably inside us.I am not denying anything said in the book. But, the way things are described in the book are too boring to read. Repeating same sentences until you feel sleepy, until you start asking yourself, ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the requirement of 198 pages to repeat the same thing?‚ÄùIt was too tedious a task for me to complete the book.Maybe Oprah Winfrey show was the real reason for the huge sale of the book, not the quality. The thought, ‚Äúhow can I say the book is bad, if a personality like Oprah Winfrey is endorsing it?‚Äù may be the reason for the sale of the book.Or perhaps the real reason is ‚ÄúLaw of Attraction.‚ÄùI am not recommending it.By the way, who am I to recommend, once Oprah had recommended it?Pros:  Timely delivery by Amazon.Cons:  Too monotonous.
title: The Secret ‚Äì ‚ÄúMonotonous, Overhyped‚Äù

text: Rating : 5/5I read the book by curiosity. The book has no story, nor even any true words based on our daily life . But the book attracted me by its positive sentences. If you read at a glance you might think , that the words of this book are utmost unbelievable , but if you give it a think it works. It works as a mental game, it gives you the positive energy to face any challenges without fear. The Secret is amazing and if one somehow managed to fuse these thoughts into regular day to day existence it would in reality be a relentless power. The fact of the matter is self-evident; in case you're feeling cheerful you are thinking glad contemplation. What is energizing is to understand that one can utilize one's emotions to comprehend what one is thinking. Further, one can utilize ones all the more promptly controllable musings to influence ones sentiments.The Secret instructs us to see today, make tomorrow, however enable the universe to decidedly impact us as we anticipate positive vitality. You realize where you're going, however you can just observe 200 ft before you. Life must be taken as it comes however we can give it course. You should remain on track, yet bargain, decidedly, with the knocks that go along the way. We should be grateful for all that is exhibited to us since it characterizes us.The book proceeds to apply the idea of inspiration to well-being, connections, bounty, appreciation, and at last life. Surely the fact is to be glad presently, feel great at this point.Some of my points I jot down from this book :‚Ä¢ Nothing can come into your experience unless you summon it thought consistently.‚Ä¢ Careful, the thoughts of doubt are powerful too.‚Ä¢ Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life‚Äôs coming attractions‚Ä¢ Use Vision boards as ways to visualize your goals‚Ä¢ What you believe it will start happening. The primary idea of this book is :‚ÄúYou are the one who calls the law of attraction into action, and you do it through your thoughts.‚Äù‚Äï Rhonda Byrne, The SecretI would recommend this book to everyone which will help you to discover your inner strength. text: General detailsAuthor: Rhonda ByrneGenre: Self helpPublished: 26 November 2006Publisher: Simon & Schuster UK LtdPages:197My review :By every turn of page it seems like everything that happened in your life makes sense, all the pieces have been put together , you have found divinity. The holocaust?Yes, I must say I liked the ‚Äúlaw of attraction‚Äù but this book tells you to live in illusion and be ignorant. keep on daydreaming and you shall have everything . Be self obsessed , think for yourself you and only you and everything around will fall into place, it tells you to think of the happy places and ignore the rest. It says if you want to achieve your ideal weight , imagine yourself that way and ‚Äúdo not look at a fat person‚Äù(quoted).This book will hypnotize you. It will make believe that your life‚Äôs going to change completely. You will rule the world. But, dear dear, don‚Äôt be misled by it. Under the possession of this book‚Äôs spell , I started following the secret and I was on the verge of insanity.It was Rhonda Byrne‚Äôs secret to Endless prosperity.My Rating: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê/53 stars just because of the writing skill.RecommendationI would never recommend anyone to read it.

text: Let us say you have X dollar in your bank account and you don't remember, exactly how much it is. Now you want Y amount but you are not writing a cheque fearing that it might get bounce. So law of attraction makes you imagine that you already have Y amount in your bank account and inspires you to write cheque. In reality, if Y is smaller than X then you will get the money and you will think that law of attraction worked. But in reality, if Y is bigger than X then you will not get the money and law of attraction will inspire you to work hard, increase money in your account and again write cheque. This time you have increased X so chances of your cheque getting encash has increased. In this way every next time you write a cheque, your chance of getting it encashed is increased and finally it reaches to 100%. The underlying principle here is not your imagination (law of attraction) but your actions (law of Karma). Your imagination has just motivated you to do actions - be it writing a cheque or working and increasing balance in your bank account.Another example is when you want to loose weight. For this law of attraction tells that you imagine yourself with perfect weight and you will see universe giving you lot of opportunities to actually loose the weight by showing you gym on your way, diet show on your favorite TV channel, etc. But in reality gym and diet show were already there, you just started to notice them in conscious mind, earlier they were sent to your subconscious mind. Here the action which produced consequent reaction was your continuous thinking and not the universe as suggested by law of attraction.Law of attraction is incomplete because it does not explain that one has to deserve and qualify himself to get what he wants. In fact, law of attraction is dangerous idea because:1) It may lead people trying to achieve impossible and put them in depression. For example, trying to change what's already happened or said in the past. You can't go back in time and fix it even if you strongly imagine yourself doing it or saying it right for rest of your life. Another dangerous thing that law of attraction has encouraged is today's youth trying to fix the impossible relationships. After studying law of attraction most of the youth apply it in first place, is to build relationship with opposite gender. In reality, they end up wasting their valuable time trying to realize their whimsical likes and not putting their energy in anything substantial. In case, boy or girl builds a relationship after lot of imagination and efforts, he or she is most likely to end it in due course because of completely different attitude, thinking and psychology of opposite person. Experts say that 85% relationships end in bitter, depressing and painful breakups [1]. Law of attraction encourages the idea that nothing is impossible and people love this idea. But in reality certain things are impossible. For example, only one person can top an entrance exam, even if 100 participants are applying law of attraction and imagining themselves topper. It's just not possible. Law of attraction binds a person to something, not allowing him to move ahead when he don't deserve it or it's not good for him.2) It makes people impatient. It may lead one to simply waste time imagining something and not giving sufficient time to work for it. No overnight success happens over a night. Any successful person will ascertain to this. But follower of law of attraction will  spend time visualizing his success everyday. And it puts him into depression or frustration at the end of 21 day or six months, when he don't really get it.3) It makes a person a plaything in the hands of three evils: Desire, Anger and Greed. Law of attraction inspires a person for more and more desires rather than living a simple and satisfied life. When a person is not able to fulfill his desire, he becomes victim of anger and frustration with life. And when his desire is fulfilled, he'll become victim of greed to achieve even more. Also the sense of success of law of attraction will lead a person to make newer and newer desires, never allowing him to be at ease with life.  It makes person forget that one day he has to give up everything he has gathered - be it fame, wealth, relationships or anything.

text: Got this as a gift and listed below are my reasons for the poor rating :1. Now, self help books are difficult to review because they are the least objective books, as in, unlike fiction or history its more like medicine....if it suits you well and good but if it doesnt then you've just wasted your time and money. Since I never purchased this book I did not feel the pinch of losing money, but yes, I did not find/ discover any secret from this book after multiple patient readings.2. If you want something the entire universe conspires you to get that thing is an old wine in new bottle thing. And personally it is the least motivating message. If you want something then you get it by hardwork but if you still dont you have to leave it there. Thats it. I mean can all of us really get whatever we desire??? May be yes. But maybe. So the bottom line is you have to look for the silver lining yourself. This book will not give you any extra gyaan.3. Self help books are mainly helping the authors who write such books( they get rich!!! whoa!!!). Not that I have anything against them but they manage to market themselves in such a way that you may tend to idolize and live by your self help guru. One saying or few sayings cannot describe the tumultuous journey of mankind. Something called a greater force prevails and one cannot change the course of one's destiny entirely. So even the most optimistic human braves a low point in his/her life. And he needs to work towards overcoming that. One may find inspiration in such books but really, you need more than words and imagination to help you in your bad times.4. YOU CANNOT REVERSE AGING. FULL STOP! Ms Byrne says you can! LOL!!!Finally, yes such books help a lot of people but cant kind words and gentle suggestions work? Why would I promote a self help book, I'd rather prefer being around someone who needs help.
title: Just another self help book really!

text: Prominent coincidences modify the brain to a greater extent than the not-so-prominent failures of the 'law of attraction', a concept the book showcases as the secret. I could imagine a work problem to get resolved by the end of the week. I could really visualise the resolve and myself enjoying the weekend with nothing to worry about. I could concentrate and truly believe it will happen. Come Friday, if the problem doesn't get resolved by itself, it won't surprise me all that much. I might not even realise that the law of attraction didn't work in this particular case. If the problem does get resolved however, it would be a prominent event for the brain, which would modify itself to believe that this methodology is linked to success of achieving things. Out of a hundred different things I try to attract using the law of attraction, even if I get a handful just out of sheer chance, my brain would modify itself to believe this actually works.¬†This trickery is nothing new though. It's just a variation of prayers, rituals, thought controls, and really many other zero correlation activities. This is not to say that the trickery is itself intended by the trickster. It could well be that even the trickster is tricked into believing into this and does not have a good understanding of the brain. Even scientists make errors of accepting false hypotheses. This is known as a Type 1 error in Statistics. Conspiracy theories find shelter in the brain and gamblers find patterns in outcomes.¬†Our brains have not evolved to see the world as it is. They have evolved to see the world as it is useful. Information by itself is useless. It is how the information is interpreted that matters. We need our brains to be able to seek out patterns and make sense of reality, even at the cost of making false conclusions. This unfortunately sometimes overlaps into the harmful more than the useful. Believing in superstitions, bogus laws of attraction, ultimate justice, sinful birth, rituals, etc have been extremely harmful to society. They have been a major friction to progress and knowledge. They distort reality and keep you from tackling problems the direct way. Entire industries like homeopathy and acupuncture have been set around it that give people false hope for recovery, and nothing more than a placebo effect at times. It diverts resources away from the proper methodology of solving problems and directs them toward meaningless activities based on wishful thinking.
title: The Secret - summarized in reality

title: Worst Book Ever

text: All my life I have struggled to hold a job, keep a woman and to gain friendships.  I have autism and so I was an easy target for bullies of both genders not just at school, but also in the Workplace.  I simply did not fit in and still don't fit in anywhere.So I got this book and now I am trying to apply what it says to my life.  I don't want millions of pounds or anything fancy, but I do want what everyone else has a loving Wife, Car, and Home to call my own.These I believe by the scope of this book are achievable and realistic goals that I am setting myself.  So it remains to be seen if this book truly can do what it says it can.After reading a couple of chapters so far all I can see is a brilliant book to teach you how to feel good in yourself.  To make yourself feel happy even when sad and depressed.  That alone is worth more than any amount of millions.  There are plenty of millionaires that are not happy at all and struggled to make more millions which in turn makes them just as miserable.This book teaches you how to look at your emotions and thoughts and feelings and change your thinking to a better place.  If you are looking for a load of quick results then don't bother.  This book will teach you how to make yourself feel good about yourself and in turn, attract good things to you, but remember good things come to those who wait.  If you cant then you won't get.As books go this is old news now, but I got it for 6 pounds second hand, hardback and in good condition.  For me, it is not worth the 14 pounds brand new price, but each to their own.  There are many different books since using the same techniques, but with clearer examples.If you expect to become a rich person after this book, then you may become one, but remember as the book says you need to really believe you already have the money and already are rich.I will update this if my life changes and I do get a job and get a nice woman in my life.  I will update this if I do get that house and what every average person has.  I will not set a time limit, but as I reach my goals I will update this review.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 July 2019
title: Keeps you positive

text: This tiny book has has a good quality cover, brown design imitating the ancient scrolls and a promise to shed some light on what is the most important thing you can do in your life.  The most important thing is to start  thinking about what you want rather than what you don't want. It is a starting point and thinking  does not become more than a wishful thinking unless you take it to the practical level.And that is - get out of the way of anyone who challenges you because you are not entitled on your own opinion. Do not fight against anything or anyone. If you  have opposition that conflicts with your desires it is negative and therefore it is not real. This sort of thinking can push you into dreaming and getting out of touch with the reality.Blame yourself first, not anything or anyone because it leads to negative thoughts about the world. You only can have positive thoughts while negative ones are not real. Do not judge. Do not resist anything.While it is truth that you can achieve more with the positive attitude, the thoughts alone and ignorance of the material reality is a way too far form the realisation of your wishes. Confirm to the  idea that everything is fine no matter what problems take place in your real life. It sounds too good and too simple.The book is for the followers of the spiritual fantasies ignoring the real material world, not for leaders or authorities.The author is nighter a therapist, a prophet or an expert in career development but certainly communicates well her ideas .  Is this the wisdom?

text: I read the book only about three weeks ago. Since then, I've also read Rhonda Byrne's "The Power", and I'm part way through "The Magic".  I've scoured the internet for more information about the Law of Attraction.  At first, I only recognized that the Law has been working in my life for my whole life.  I have mostly attracted negative things in the past, not realizing what has been going on.  But realizing now that the Law is real has given me inspiration and faith.  I am now on a new path, and the Law is beginning to work for me; I have already attracted some good and amazing things.  But at this early stage, I still need to learn to trust the Law, and develop a greater faith in it.  This is a very personal journey, and it requires one to become more intimate with their thoughts, beliefs and desires.  It takes a measure of work and a bit of devotion.  "The Secret" doesn't provide everything needed in this journey, but it's an excellent starting point.

text: Somebody I know recently recommended me 'The Secret', telling me with tears in her eyes (literally) about how it transformed her life, and that she reads passages from it every day to cement its messages into her head. I must admit that I do dabble in flowery "spiritual" self-help books from time-to-time, and that I'm quite quick to defend them against the many detractors who stick their nose up at them and look down at the people who read them. The Dalai Lama's books, for instance, had an absolutely enormous impact on my life when I started reading them during my angst filled early 20s. I say this because I don't want you to think that I'm writing this review with any biases against spiritual and self-help books when I say that 'The Secret' by Rhonda Byrne is truly shocking. In fact, I can safely say that it's the single worst, most pretentious, unethical and downright idiotic book I've ever read in my life. I forced myself to finish the whole book, because I actually paid money for the damn thing, and by the end of it I actually felt angry. I don't remember the last time that a book made me feel angry, so I think Rhonda Byrne deserves a pat on the back for that.I didn't feel angry because the book was so badly written (which, indeed, it was), but because of the very premise of it, which has struck a chord with so many millions of people across the world since Oprah championed it on her TV show years ago. In numerous paragraphs, which basically repeat the same theme over and over again, Byrne and her collaborators nurture the most selfish materialistic view of life imaginable, preaching not a "Gospel of Wealth", but something even more sinister. At least that encourages the concept that you have to work hard to gain your wealth, and that giving to charity is good. Rather, Byrne et al preach the message that money and material possessions are everything that matters, that they're attainable only by merely thinking positively (in itself, not necessarily a bad message, but I'll get back to that later), and that anyone who doesn't have money, or has some other problem in their life, has brought it on themselves for thinking negatively. Victim of child abuse? Brought it on his/herself. The civil war in Syria? They brought it on themselves. But the banksters, the tax-evading CEOs and the sweatshop owners? They brought all their glorious wealth to themselves through making full use of the natural harmony of "the universe", thinking positively and being grateful for what they have, and they deserve it all.Now, focusing on positive thinking, visualisation exercises in helping you to achieve your dreams, etc., is a great thing. We know from science and psychology that the power of positive thinking is an incredible tool in helping people to recover from serious illnesses, make friends, get good jobs, etc., and this should be encouraged. One or two of the exercises suggested in this book are actually very good too. But this book peddles the idea that it's the only thing that matters, and it does so under the most wishy-washy flowery and pretentious language I've ever come across. This is a book designed for people who want quick fixes, people who would give anything to believe that you can win the lottery tomorrow by not just visualising it, but also convincing yourself that you've already won. If you're drowning in a sea of debt, you're told to convince yourself that you're a millionaire and then, when you truly believe it, you'll start having cheques coming through your letterbox out of nowhere instead of bills. This is neurotic. 'The Secret' is literally encouraging people to be crazy, to think only of their own self interests, and then (the worst part) to blame people who aren't rich, people who are depressed, people who just lost a parent, for thinking negative thoughts that caused all of their problems. This is an absolutely horrendous book in every conceivable way.

title: Four Stars

text: Reading this book is like being told about a great film by someone who saw it on a plane; shoddily related and in danger of ruining a good thing for you.You know what it's about by now. As a science student this book appalled me - the writing standard is shocking. There's no real structure, quotes are miscellaneous. If you read the first ten pages you can stop, because you won't learn anything new after that. If I handed this in to my lecturers, I thought, I'd be in real danger of failing, positive thinking or no.The worst part is that some really interesting ideas are presented here, they're just presented in such a frivolous manner! As if exclamation marks explain everything! It's infuriating, and a waste considering that a lot of people are discovering these ideas through this book. Frankly I cannot believe it was allowed into print as it stands. It simply isn't good enough.There's also a pervading attitude towards hard work that's at best misleading and at worst dangerous. The only mention of actually working towards your goals is to say that it should feel easy, when the success stories presented are of people who worked for it. I can't say whether it was easy for them or not, but the notion of working is completely skipped over. You could argue that getting what you want without working for it is the crux of this particular book, (though not necessarily the ideas it's based on), and this is an entirely personal viewpoint, but you shouldn't look to get through life without working for what you have. You'll be so much better for it. Bear in mind how biased that makes my review as I seem to disagree with the core of this book, but I can't help but feel I could be far more objective if the book in question were written by a more capable author.Clearly I've highlighted far too many flaws to recommend this book; it would lose none of its value if someone else read it and summed it up for you. By reading these reviews you've negated the need for it. If it's self-help you want I'm sure there are better sources out there. As an authority on the Law of Attraction it's worth a glance, (at someone else's copy), as long as you accept straight off that it's an interpretation, and a poorly written one at that.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 17 August 2008

text: I've read countless books on self development over the years, some great and  some not so great. This definitely ranks in the not so great category. I've experienced a lot of success in my life and it comes down to three things. 1. Effort. 2 Attitude and 3. The way you treat other people. This book focuses on point 2. Whilst I am a huge advocate of having a positive outlook and nurturing the mind with positive thoughts and have daily rituals to that end some of the content in here is just absolute nonsense. Being on the same "frequency" as the universe "getting whatever you want" just by thinking it are the kind of concepts that give this industry a bad name. Thought without action accomplishes nothing.

text: This is by no means the most thorough, complete or comprehensive book on using your mind and emotions to attract what you want in life, and it wasn't the first book about this topic that I'd personally come across either. Having said that, this work (both the book and the original film) has been a wonderful catalyst for introducing a large number of people to the concept of being able to actively draw your desires towards you by using the power of your mental faculties. I saw the film and then read the book for the first time years ago, when I was just emerging into adulthood. I'd previously come across a few works that spoke along similar lines, but the enthusiasm, simplicity and immediacy of this book's message really cemented the idea in my head that I could truly start trying to direct the content and direction of my life from within.It resulted in my first real life experiment in manifesting something for myself- an experiment which proved to be an immediate success. While walking through a large department store looking for a birthday gift for my best friend (we always spent $50 on each other), I realised I was broke- I had another week before pay day, and I desperately needed to buy more petrol for my car so I could keep going to uni that week, and I had less than $100 in the bank. Buying my friend's gift was basically more than I could afford that week. I thought to myself, "If only I had an extra $50 to tide me over for the week- that's all I'd need to get through till pay day." I decided to attract the money. I just sort of mentally projected the request for $50, then immediately stopped thinking about it, acted as though it was done. Three minutes later I literally stepped on a $50 note in an abandoned section of the car park, nowhere near any cars or people who may have dropped it. That day, thanks to this book, I really realised I had a concrete ability to positively effect my own life.
title: Wonderful introductory catalyst for change

text: Please ingnore the neg comments and buy the cd audio version! its worth every penny!!!!In my view the negative comments are miss-understanding what the secret is trying to get across, though for me the secret is very obvious & beautifully put, but then I am trained in neuro-science and matters of the unconscious mind, and once you understand how the brain works then its easy to understand how the secret can work.The main thread of 'the secret' is NOT about positive thinking, or wishing.The main thread or principle to create change is about taking time out to 'imaginine' your desired self (in a realistic way of course).If you take time out each day to sit down close your eyes and imagine your desired self often, then its far more likely you will attain it, because its scientifically proven that the brain does not know you are imagining, thus the brain thinks what you run though your imagination 'is real' and hence it eventually acts accordingly if you have imagined your desired self many times, the trick being to do it often.I use imagining methods with my clients all the time and their lives completely transform, & you only need to read the positive reviews which also reflect this.Indeed people are right in saying that positive thinking alone wont do much in the long run and thats true! but the KEY in 'the secret' is "IMAGINING" imagining your desired self (realistically).I would strongly encourage people to buy the cd version and NOT the book, the cd is so much more inspiring and its so much more understandable listening to the cd. I've done both & the cd is miles more effective & empowering.The law of attraction works both ways and so for those who believe it to be rubbish then it will be so for them because that is what they believe and have attracted to them selves, its just the law of attraction working in reverse!The only bit I dont like about the secret is a slight christian thread that runs through it which i feel is imposing on people and disrespectful to those who have a different religious belief so that is why i have only give it 4 stars.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 2 June 2011
title: A good investment by far!! cd audio version best!

text: I purchased this book after reading a review about it.  At the time I was in a job that I struggled with and I felt very down about myself.Within the first half an hour of reading I quickly learned that my own perspective of things had to change.  The book is about 'The laws of attraction' basicaly meaning that to get good things in your life you must see the positive as negativity attracts negativity.  It makes you stop and think about how your mood and thoughts can change everything and everyone around you.There are topics on using 'The Secret' in relationships and love, money, health and life.  These are in easy readable sections and have a summary at the end of each.  There are also thought provoking quotes from writers throughout.Some of the writers, who have contributed to this book, have helped people to become self fulfilled, high flying business people and millionaires just by using the mind power of positivity.  This book teaches you to say 'I will' and 'I can' instead of 'I won't' or 'I can't'.I am pleased to say that since reading this book, I have identified my stresses and I am making changes for the better.  Well worth a read.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 January 2010
title: A thought provoking book.

text: I believed in inner power and the substance of the Universe, however my life was still extremely frustrating at times and i didn't know why. Several years ago somebody recommended the DVD of The Secret to me so i went with it and, after watching it, felt totally inspired, so much so I handed my notice in at work to develop myself.A couple of years later and the biggest change was in my mind and mental outlook on life. The Secret set me on a journey of discovering the original new thought authors from late 1800's and slowly, but surely, I have seen changes. Last year I discovered two authors and everything clicked into place, namely Neville Goddard and Joanne St.Clair. These authors really heightened the journey of discovery which The Secret set me on, resulting in a six figure lottery win earlier this year.I would definately recommend this book and the DVD, but just sticking to this and nothing else is not enough. If you really want change you must keep discovering your inner Spirit and its relationships to life. Neville taught me more about the imagination and its use, and Joanne St.Clair put it all into perspective in a very modern and down to earth way.Enjoy.
date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 December 2011
title: Started an Amazing Journey

text: The trouble with this book is that they are missing a component out.  Sure, the Law of Attraction works because if exhibit positive body language and express yourself in positive words and phrases, you will attract positive people to you, allowing your to make social and business connections to helf you achieve your goals.However, I have a problem with the idea that you just have to think and believe something and it will happen.  What Byrne has missed out is: you have to put in "pathways" to make your visualisation come true. For example, if you want a better physique, you can visualise how you want to look and feel, but then you have to go to the gym regularly and avoid fatty foods!

text: I love books and like to change around what I read.someone I work with mentioned this book and how good it was.I read it in a few days as I was intrigued to what the hype was about.All I can say is its a lovely thought but in reality with the way things are in the world its just not possible I did everything in that book that was suggested and I rigidly stuck to it and I felt for a while optimistic and wanted to believe what I asked the universe to give me I was 100% going to get.  Let me tell you forcing yourself to be happy and believe in such things makes for Major disapointment you have to except you arent going to get most things you want in life as thats just the way it is, the book has more holes in than a sieve please dont waste your money just live you life try to be happy and be grateful for what you have as soon as I stopped asking and thinking positive thoughts 24/7 I was more happy and not exhausted at trying to be what a normal human is we are emotional, moody angry and some of us tainted by life but so what thats what makes us unique buy the happiness trap it makes a lot more sense to except what you have rather than expecting the world to fall on your lap.

text: This was a concept I have been aware of for many years, only this book has more detail of how to use the law of attraction. Cosmic ordering is another term widely used. It makes sense, and appears to be backed up by quantum physics. It's really an option and belief system that one might adopt, and is an alternative to other belief sytems out there.  I personally would say there have been elements of thruth to this in my experience. For instance thinking of a person, and somehow you bump into them a few days later, or they give you a call out of the blue...that's one example of the law of attraction. we do tend to complain about many things and not the positive in our lives, which the book says only serves to draw more negative experiences to us. We would need to remain positive and feel good, (if that is possible) to ensure only good things enter our lives. The law of attraction it says is always working and mirrors our thoughts.  These dominant thoughts will enter our lives, this energy going out into the universe and returning to source. Our lives are a mirror of our thoughts. That is the law of attraction it states, and is in perfect balance. For those looking to change something in there lives Byrne's book is worthy of consideration, but may take some time to accept for others if at all.

text: I was recommended this book by my counsellor, who advised me to take some of the advice with a bit of salt, but the whole time I was reading it (I managed two chapters) I kept thinking of that IT Crowd episode where Douglas becomes a Spaceologist ("Something Happened") and couldn't stop laughing enough to carry on as it reads exactly like Spaceologist propaganda.It is like a giant advertisement where they just repeat the same sentiment using slightly different phrasing as there is simply not enough actual content to fill the book, other than the condescending crap about how everything wrong in your life is your fault because you're thinking about it wrong. The whole book can be summarised as "Think positive thoughts and you will be more aware of positive things in your life and have a more positive outlook". Reading that quote means you have basically read the whole book without having to also read actual quotes such as ‚ÄúFood cannot cause you to put on weight, unless you think it can.‚Äù or ‚ÄúThe only reason any person does not have enough money is because they are blocking money from coming to them with their thoughts.‚Äù - what a load of drivel.Total waste of money.

title: Good book

text: First off, I do like this book and also The Power.  They encourage positivity and gratitude which are good things and can help you in life because positivity and gratitude make people want to help you out and give you things and I believe that a lot  of people have changed their lives, gained health, wealth and happiness by following the words in this book.However, the Law of Attraction is only one force in the universe, of which there are many and seeing the LOA as the one and only force in the universe can be dangerous in that it can re-victimise, for example, a victim of rape.  A teenage girl is walking down the street on her way home from a friend's house, it's gone dark but she hasn't got far to go and she feels safe in her neighbourhood and bam, she gets raped - she blames herself, as most victims of this crime do, it isn't her fault and she felt safe enough walking, feeling positive and yet, this other force attacked her.  This kind of thing happens all the time.  Is it really a good idea for a person to think that the relative that sexually assaulted her or the group of kids that relentlessly bullied him or the car that came out of nowhere and collided with their car is the fault of the person that got hurt, that they were attracting it and they could have done something different to prevent it?  That is the kind of thinking that they need to be encouraged out of.  If a person is hurt or injured they need loving words of encouragement, not "it's your fault, you must have wanted it".I wouldn't like to think of a person walking down the street thinking "the world is a lovely place and I attract nothing but lovely things to me" and not being vigilant to dark corners and alleyways and other people around them. I wouldn't like to think of a person being conned out of a large amount of money thinking that because they're being kind and positive that that is what they will always get in return.  I also wouldn't like someone to read this book and ignore their instincts when it is trying to tell them something because they've read a book that says you get what you give out and giving out positivity means that's what is coming back.  There are a lot of people that take advantage of such a naive outlook on life.It is a very good book and a very good concept but it's not the be all and end all of a perfect happy life.  Gratitude and a positive attitude work very well when used with common sense and listening to your instincts and remembering that the Law of Attraction is not the only force in the universe.

text: I, like many people bought this book after hearing all the hype.  I read it quite quickly and found it an inspiring read.  However, I did find it a little repetitive at times, with the same point being made over and over again by different people, ie you will manifest what you think about. The basic message itself is a positive one and if we can all be encouraged to think more positively that can only be a good thing. The use of visualisation and focusing on the positive are all great tools to have as you are then more likely to be drawn to good things, be more in touch with your intuition and to notice opportunities. However, sometimes we might start out thinking we want something and then discover it isn't what we wanted afterall, so the ability to be open minded to adapt our goals and desires are also important.If you want to make improvements to your life then this is a good place to start.  However, to make long lasting changes, then I truly believe that more is required than just postive thinking, such as setting goals, taking action and developing resilience. If you want a book that helps you achieve all this, then I would recommend adding a little Serendipity to your Secret and read the fantastic¬†

text: I am finding the secret very powerful as a tool for changing my daily life around. I am learning how to focus my energy in a positive way, put out there what I want in a positive way and find it easier being positive about people and things. I am working with the ask, believe and receive and am trying to believe that I have received from just believing and find it helps me to go about my day in a more positive manner.It is a useful tool for believing in a higher power and I have learnt that you can tell your higher power any thing you want about your day and positive stuff happens, even stuff in your day that might seem negative and difficult to face get esasier as does communication with people. I try to reflect stuff back that comes at me negatively in a positive way however this doesn't happen all the time depending on whether the person is open to receive or not but certainly it is easier putting your point of view across, you get listened to and it doesn't feel as scary to deal with people especially if those people carry authority and I have found it easier finding jobs to apply for since reading the secret, I am getting responses to job applications and also find it easier filling in my job searches because I am more positively focused and driven.

text: There is no secret I am afraid! "The Secret" is just a long drawn out way to encourage positive thinking. I would have preferred a more straightforward read with a book about positive thinking. Do not for heaven's sake make my mistake of buying the audio book; it is accompanied by mysterious music and sounds!! Really off putting. The bit that annoyed me is that it gives the impression that if you find out "The Secret" you will come into lots of money. Utter nonsense. Yes you can earn lots of money if you work hard and have the right (positive) attitude but it's not going to just happen because you have  bought the book. The author is coming into lots of money though by selling so many!!I'll let you into a secret - I wish I hadn't bought it!!!! It's rubbish!I have given 2 stars because the author is so keen and she has managed to write a book which I know is pretty tricky.
